lines.content: Welcome to the Sayo User Guide. This document will help you understand how to use Sayo, the friendly chatbot designed to keep track of various tasks.
Shows a list of all tasks.
Adds a todo task to the list.
Marks the task at the specified index as done.
Unmarks the task at the specified index.
Adds a task with a deadline.
Adds an event happening between two dates.
Deletes the task at the specified index.
Finds all tasks that contain the given keyword.
1. Ensure Java 11 or above is installed on your computer.
2. Download the latest version of `Sayo.jar` from our [Releases page](https://github.com/soongensayo/ip/releases/tag/v1.0.0).
3. Run the program using the command `java -jar Sayo.jar`.
4. Start interacting with Sayo using the commands listed above.
Welcome to the Sayo User Guide. This document will help you understand how to use Sayo, the friendly chatbot designed to keep track of various tasks.
Shows a list of all tasks.
Adds a todo task to the list.
Marks the task at the specified index as done.
Unmarks the task at the specified index.
Adds a task with a deadline.
Adds an event happening between two dates.
Deletes the task at the specified index.
Finds all tasks that contain the given keyword.
1. Ensure Java 11 or above is installed on your computer.
2. Download the latest version of `Sayo.jar` from our [Releases page](https://github.com/soongensayo/ip/releases/tag/v1.0.0).
3. Run the program using the command `java -jar Sayo.jar`.
4. Start interacting with Sayo using the commands listed above.

* Represents an exception specific to the Sayo application.
* This class extends the {@code Exception} class and is used to handle
* application-specific exceptions that occur during the operation of Sayo.
* Constructs a new {@code SayoException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message which provides more information about the exception.
* Handles storage operations for Sayo application tasks.
* This includes loading from and saving tasks to a file.
* Constructs a new Storage object to handle file operations.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Loads tasks from the specified file into a list of strings.
* @return A list of strings representing tasks.
* @throws SayoException If an I/O error occurs reading from the file.
throw new SayoException("An error occurred while loading tasks from file.");
* Saves the current list of tasks to the file.
* @param items The list of tasks to be saved.
System.out.println("An error occurred while saving tasks to file.");
* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Marks the task as done by setting its status to true.
* Unmarks the task as not done by setting its status to false.
* Returns the status icon representing the completion of the task.
* @return A string representation of the task's completion status.
* Returns the string representation of the task formatted for file storage.
* @return A string formatted for saving to a file.
return (isDone ? "1" : "0") + " | " + description; // This basic format will be extended by subclasses

* Adds a task to the list.

* Returns the number of tasks in the list.

* Returns the entire list of tasks.

* @param keyword The string to search for within task descriptions.

* Represents a to-do task with a description.
* Constructs a new ToDo with the given description.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Returns the string representation of the to-do task.
* Prefixes the base task string representation with "[T]" to denote a to-do task.
* @return A string representation of the to-do task.

* Prefixes the base task file format with "T |" to denote a to-do task.

* Parses the string based on the predefined format and creates a ToDo object accordingly.
* @param fileFormat A string representing the task in file format.
* @return A new ToDo object populated with the data from the fileFormat string.
* Ui class handles the user interface for the Sayo application.
* It manages the input and output in the console.
* Initializes the scanner to read user input.
* Method to print a horizontal line for UI separation.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Sayo and it's great to see you! \nWhat can I do for you today?\n");
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays an error message when loading tasks fails.
System.out.println("You have no saved tasks! \nStart using me :)");
* Displays an error message when loading tasks fails.

* @param task The task that has been marked.
System.out.println("Awesome! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been unmarked.
* @param task The task that has been unmarked.
* Displays a message confirming that a new task has been added.
* @param todo The todo task that was added.
* @param items The current list of tasks, used to display the new total count.
public void showAddedTaskMessage(ToDo todo, TaskList items) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + items.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prompts the user to enter the deadline in the correct format.
System.out.println("Please enter the deadline in the format: deadline <deadline description> /by <due date>");

System.out.println("Now you have " + items.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prompts the user to enter the event in the correct format.
System.out.println("Please enter the event in the format: event <event description> /from <start time> /to <end time>");
